page.title: 11MAPPERCOMBE MANOR CONT.
page.content: The Brown family lived in the Manor for 200 years. The last of the Brown family to live there were two brothers who always argued so finally they split the whole estate between them. As a child Mr. William Crutchley found a silver spoon, probably thrown by the Brown brothers, when a yew arch was cut. The next owner was a 'gin maker' he installed acetylene gas lighting in 1900, also he built Brown's Farm now home of Mr. William Crutchley. The Crutchley family, the present owners, came to the Manor in 1938 and installed electricity. The estate contains 1960 acres; 100 acres is woodland mainly deciduous. At one time there were 14 farms now managed by one. At one time water was a problem for farms until pumps were installed. These are some of the types of farming dairy,arable,sheep & beef cattle.
